item.title: Nato's border with Russia doubles as Finland joins
item.description: Finland hands over the document to become the 31st Nato member, in a setback for Russia's Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Darya Trepova: Russia cafe bomb suspect charged with terrorism
item.description: Darya Trepova was arrested on Monday after the St Petersburg killing of pro-war blogger Vladlen Tatarsky.

item.title: Bangladesh market engulfed by fire as many shops burned down
item.description: There have been no reported deaths from the fire, which burned down thousands of shops.

item.title: Virgin Orbit: Richard Branson's rocket firm files for bankruptcy
item.description: The satellite launch company has failed to secure new investment after a rocket launch failed.

item.title: Arunachal Pradesh: India rejects China's attempt to rename disputed places
item.description: Delhi's comments come amid reports that China has renamed 11 places along a disputed Himalayan border region.

item.title: Dutch rail crash: One dead after passenger train hits crane and derails
item.description: The crash happened when a passenger train hit a construction crane near the village of Voorschoten.

item.title: Climate change: Catalonia in grip of worst drought in decades
item.description: Water levels at a reservoir in the northern Spanish region have fallen below 10% of its capacity.

item.title: Khalid al-Jabouri: US says IS Europe attack planner killed in Syria strike
item.description: Khalid al-Jabouri was the target of a strike on Monday that reportedly took place in Idlib province.

item.title: Child attacked by dingo on Australia's K'gari-Fraser Island
item.description: A young girl is airlifted to hospital after being bitten at popular tourist spot K'gari-Fraser Island.

item.title: Australian rugby and NFL star Jarryd Hayne guilty of rape
item.description: It is the third time the former Parramatta Eels player has faced trial on the same allegations.

item.title: Irvo Otieno: Death of man in police custody ruled a homicide
item.description: The 28-year-old died in March while being transferred from a jail to a mental health facility.

item.title: BTS' Jimin first S Korea solo artist to top US Billboard charts
item.description: Jimin has debuted his new single Like Crazy at the top of the Billboard Hot 100 rankings.

item.title: Can Trump turn prosecution into an election asset?
item.description: The former president's historic court date in Manhattan is also an election campaign event.

item.title: Ukraine war: Who are Russia's war bloggers and why are they popular?
item.description: Vladlen Tatarsky, killed in a cafe blast, was one of Russia's "war correspondents". But who are they?

item.title: Timed Teaser: Where are Pablo Escobar's hippos heading?
item.description: Test your knowledge of the news these last few days - 10 questions, 10 seconds each. Go!

item.title: Why the Wisconsin Supreme Court election matters
item.description: The most important race youâ€™ve never heard of is happening in Wisconsin.

item.title: Angola landmines: The women hunting for explosives left from civil war
item.description: Clearing the remnants of Angola's war is dangerous but many are keen to stop the needless deaths.

item.title: Life after Daft Punk: Thomas Bangalter on ballet, AI and ditching the helmet
item.description: The musician discusses Daft Punk's demise, the rise of Artificial Intelligence and his new ballet.

item.title: A nutty solution for cleaner stoves and barbecues
item.description: Cleaner fuels for cooking could improve health and be better for the environment.

item.title: Ramadan: How to look after your skin during holy month
item.description: TikTok's most famous dermatologist Dr Muneeb Shah is sharing his top tips for the holy month.

item.title: Trump arraignment: Private plane, agents, protests expected on journey
item.description: A widely-tracked flight from Florida to New York preceded the former US president's appearance in court.

item.title: Darya Trepova: What we know about accused in Russian blogger Vladlen Tatarsky's killing
item.description: Darya Trepova seems to be an opponent of the invasion, but friends say she was not radical.

item.title: Afghanistan: Rounded up from the streets into Taliban drug rehab
item.description: Afghanistan's government is running an aggressive campaign to remove drug users from the streets.

item.title: Mexico migrants 'didn't deserve to die this way'
item.description: There is growing outrage over a fire which killed at least 39 people at a migrant centre in Mexico.

item.title: The other Chinese apps taking the US and UK by storm
item.description: Four out of the top 10 most downloaded free mobile apps in the US and UK are Chinese-owned.

item.title: The moment Finland joined Nato security alliance
item.description: The Finnish foreign minister handed over the accession document, making the country the 31st to join Nato.

item.title: Watch stunning EarthCam clip of NYC lightning strike
item.description: A massive bolt hit the tallest building in New York City, lighting up the night sky on Saturday.

item.title: Russia: The moments leading up to St Petersburg cafe blast
item.description: Russian pro-war blogger Vladlen Tatarsky was killed by an explosion after being handed a statuette.

item.title: World's deepest fish: Expedition chief on how video was filmed
item.description: Scientist Alan Jamieson explains how his team captured footage 8,336m (27,349ft) under water.

item.title: Lightning storm illuminates skies above Illinois
item.description: The phenomenon was seen just days after a series of tornadoes ripped through several US states, including Illinois.

item.title: Andrew Tate: See luxury villa where brothers are under house arrest
item.description: The BBC's Lucy Williamson looks at the compound where Andrew Tate and brother Tristan are confined.
